Stay updated with the latest Anganwadi job notifications from all states, including Karnataka, TN, Telangana, UP, AP, Maharashtra, Bihar and more Anganwadi Recruitment 2025 - Overview Category Details Recruitment Name Anganwadi Recruitment 2025 Conducted By State Governments under ICDS Scheme Available Posts Anganwadi Worker, Helper, Mini Worker, Supervisor Educational Qualification Worker/Mini Worker: 10th Pass Helper: 8th Pass Supervisor: Graduate
age_limit: 18 to 35/40 years (varies by state) Application Mode Offline / Online (state-wise) Selection Process Merit-based on academic marks, document verification, interview Required Documents Educational Certificates, ID Proof, Address Proof, Photo, Caste Certificate Who Can Apply for Anganwadi Job Vacancy 2025? The Ministry of Women and Child Development (WCD) has defined clear eligibility criteria for candidates who wish to apply for various Anganwadi posts across India. These guidelines ensure that suitable and qualified individuals are selected for the welfare and development of children and women at the grassroots level Gender : Both male and female candidates are eligible to apply for Anganwadi job roles Age Limit: Applicants must be at least 18 years old and not older than 40 years (age relaxation may apply as per government norms) Educational Qualification: Minimum Qualification: 10th pass from a recognized board Higher Posts: Candidates applying for Supervisor or Officer-level posts should have a graduate degree or qualifications relevant to the post Residential Status: The applicant must be a permanent resident of the respective state/district where the vacancy is announced Language Proficiency: Must be able to read, write, and speak the local language of the region where applying Documents Required for Anganwadi Application Make sure to keep the following documents ready at the time of application: Document Purpose Aadhar Card Identity verification Domicile Certificate Proof of residence in the respective state or district Caste Certificate To claim reservation benefits (if applicable) Educational Certificates Proof of academic qualifications Passport Size Photo For use in application form Mobile Number For communication and updates Email ID To receive official communication (if required) Signature For form submission and verification Anganwadi Selection Process 2025 The selection process for Anganwadi jobs is mostly merit-based and conducted by the respective State Women and Child Development (WCD) departments. Here's how it works Application Submission: Candidates need to fill and submit the Anganwadi application form along with all required documents before the deadline, either online or offline as per their state Document Verification: After applications are received, officials verify the submitted documents like educational certificates, identity proof, domicile certificate, and caste certificate (if applicable) Merit List Preparation: Based on the marks obtained in 8th, 10th, or 12th standard (depending on the post), a merit list is prepared. No written examination is usually conducted for Worker and Helper posts Interview (if applicable): Some states may conduct a short interview for final verification or for supervisor-level posts Final Selection: The final list of selected candidates is published on the district’s official WCD website or notice board. Selected candidates may also receive a call or SMS regarding joining formalities.
